<|endoftext|>/*
Check if in given vector of numbers, are any two numbers closer to each other than
given threshold.
>>> has_close_elements({1.0, 2.0, 3.0}, 0.5)
false
>>> has_close_elements({1.0, 2.8, 3.0, 4.0, 5.0, 2.0}, 0.3)
true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <math.h>
using std;
bool has_close_elements(vector < float > numbers, float threshold) {
    int i, j;
   
    float sum = 0;
    float min_diff = threshold;
    
    for (i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    
    for (i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        float diff = numbers[i] - sum;
        if (diff < min_diff) {
            min_diff = diff;
        }
    }
    
    for (i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        float diff = numbers[i] - sum;
        if (diff < min_diff) {
            int j;
            for (j = i; j < numbers.size(); j++) {
                if (numbers[j] - numbers[i] < min_diff) {
                    min_diff = numbers[j] - numbers[i];
                }
            }
        }
    }
    
    return min_diff < threshold;
}

Given a positive integer n, return a vector that has the number of even and odd
integer palindromes that fall within the range(1, n), inclusive.

Example 1:

    Input: 3
    Output: (1, 2)
    Explanation:
    Integer palindrome are 1, 2, 3. one of them is even, and two of them are odd.

Example 2:

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Out of vector of strings, return the longest one. Return the first one in case of multiple
strings of the same length. Return None in case the input vector is empty.
>>> longest({})

>>> longest({"a", "b", "c"})
"a"
>>> longest({"a", "bb", "ccc"})
"ccc"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
string longest(vector < string > strings) {
    string out;
   
    if (strings.empty()) {
        return out;
    }
    
    string longest = strings[0];
    
    for (size_t i = 1; i < strings.size(); ++i) {
        if (strings[i].length() > longest.length()) {
            longest = strings[i];
        }
    }
    
    return longest;
}

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function which returns the largest index of an element which
is not greater than or equal to the element immediately preceding it. If
no such element exists then return -1. The given vector will not contain
duplicate values.

Examples:
can_arrange({1,2,4,3,5}) = 3
can_arrange({1,2,3}) = -1
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
int can_arrange(vector < int > arr) {
   
    int largest = -1;
    int largestIndex = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++) {
        if (arr[i] <= arr[largest]) {
            largest = i;
            largestIndex = i;
        }
    }
    return largestIndex;
}

Create a function which returns the largest index of an element which
is not greater than or equal to the element immediately preceding it. If
no such element exists then return -1. The given vector will not contain
duplicate values.

Examples:
can_arrange({1,2,4,3,5}) = 3
can_arrange({1,2,3}) = -1
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
int can_arrange(vector < int > arr) {
   
    int largest = -1;
    int largestIndex = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++) {
        if (arr[i] <= arr[largest]) {
            largest = i;
            largestIndex = i;
        }
    }
    return largestIndex;
}

*/

    for(int i=1;i<=n;i++){
        bfact=bfact*i;

    return fact*bfact;
}

Find how many times a given substring can be found in the original string. Count overlaping cases.
>>> how_many_times("", "a")
0
>>> how_many_times("aaa", "a")
3
>>> how_many_times("aaaa", "aa")
3
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
int how_many_times(string str, string substring) {
    int out = 0;
   
    for (int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++) {
        if (str[i] == substring[0]) {
            out += 1;
            for (int j = 1; j < substring.size(); j++) {
                if (str[i + j]!= substring[j]) {
                    break;
                }
                else {
                    out += 1;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Concatenate vector of strings into a single string
>>> concatenate({})
""
>>> concatenate({"a", "b", "c"})
"abc"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
string concatenate(vector < string > strings) {
   
   string result;
   for (string s : strings) {
      result += s;
   }
   return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that start with a given prefix.
>>> filter_by_prefix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_prefix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_prefix(vector < string > strings, string prefix) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.substr(0, prefix.size()) == prefix) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that end with a given suffix.
>>> filter_by_suffix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_suffix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_suffix(vector < string > strings, string suffix) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.substr(s.size() - suffix.size(), suffix.size()) == suffix) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that contain a given substring.
>>> filter_by_substring({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_substring({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_substring(vector < string > strings, string substring) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.find(substring)!= string::npos) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

   vector < string > result;

      if (s.find(substring)!= string::npos && s.length() > length) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }

<|endoftext|>/*
Return only positive numbers in the vector.
>>> get_positive({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{2, 5, 6}
>>> get_positive({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{5, 3, 2, 3, 9, 123, 1}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < float > get_positive(vector < float > l) {
   
   vector < float > r;
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] > 0) {
         r.push_back(l[i]);
      }
   }
   return r;
}

   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] < 0) {
         r.push_back(l[i]);
      }
   }
   return r;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return the number of times the digit 7 appears in integers less than n which are divisible by 11 or 13.
>>> fizz_buzz(50)
0
>>> fizz_buzz(78)
2
>>> fizz_buzz(79)
3
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
int fizz_buzz(int n) {
    int count = 0;
    int i = 0;
while (i < n) {
        if (i % 11 == 0 or i % 13 == 0)
         {
            int q = i;
           
            while (q > 0) {
                q = q / 10;
                count++;
            }
            i = q;
        }
        i++;
    }
    return count;
}

        }
        i++;
    }
    return count;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
prime_fib returns n-th number that is a Fibonacci number and it's also prime.
>>> prime_fib(1)
2
>>> prime_fib(2)
3
>>> prime_fib(3)
5
>>> prime_fib(4)
13
>>> prime_fib(5)
89
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include <iostream>
#include <random>


using namespace std;

bool miller_rabin(long long n, int k = 10) {
    if (n < 2) {
        return false;
    }
    if (n == 2 || n == 3) {
        return true;
    }
    if (n % 2 == 0) {
        return false;
    }

    int r = 0;
    long long d = n - 1;
    while (d % 2 == 0) {
        r++;
        d /= 2;
    }

    std::random_device rd;
    std::mt19937_64 gen(rd());
    std::uniform_int_distribution<long long> dis(2, n - 2);

    for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
        long long a = dis(gen);
        long long x = 1;
        while (d > 0) {
            if (d % 2 == 1) {
                x = (x * a) % n;
            }
            d /= 2;
        }
        if (x == n) {
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

bool is_prime(long long n) {
    if (n < 2) {
        return false;
    }
    if (n == 2) {
        return true;
    }
    if (n % 2 == 0) {
        return false;
    }

    int r = 0;
    long long d = n - 1;
    while (d % 2 == 0) {
        r++;
        d /= 2;
    }

    std::random_device rd;
    std::mt19937_64 gen(rd());
    std::uniform_int_distribution<long long> dis(2, n - 2);

    for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
        long long a = dis(gen);
        long long x = 1;
        while (d > 0) {
            if (d % 2 == 1) {
                x = (x * a) % n;
            }
            d /= 2;
        }
        if (x == n) {
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

"22"

"1000"

#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string change_base(int x,int base){
	if (x == 0){
		return "0";
	}
    string out="";
    while (x!= 0){
        int rem = x % base;
        out += (char)('0' + rem);
        x /= base;
    }
    return out;
}

}

<|endoftext|>/*
The Fib4 number sequence is a sequence similar to the Fibbonacci sequnece that's defined as follows:
fib4(0) -> 0
fib4(1) -> 0
fib4(2) -> 2
fib4(3) -> 0
fib4(n) -> fib4(n-1) + fib4(n-2) + fib4(n-3) + fib4(n-4).
Please write a function to efficiently compute the n-th element of the fib4 number sequence.  Do not use recursion.
>>> fib4(5)
4
>>> fib4(6)
8
>>> fib4(7)
14
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
int fib4(int n) {
    int f [ 100 ];
    f [ 0 ] = 0;
    f [ 1 ] = 0;
    f [ 2 ] = 2;
   
    for(int i = 3; i <= n; i++) {
        f [ i ] = f [ i - 1 ] + f [ i - 2 ] + f [ i - 3 ] + f [ i - 4 ];
    }
    return f [ n ];
}

<|endoftext|>/*
remove_vowels is a function that takes string and returns string without vowels.
>>> remove_vowels("")
""
>>> remove_vowels("abcdef\nghijklm")
"bcdf\nghjklm"
>>> remove_vowels("abcdef")
"bcdf"
>>> remove_vowels("aaaaa")
""
>>> remove_vowels("aaBAA")
"B"
>>> remove_vowels("zbcd")
"zbcd"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
#include <algorithm>
using std;
string remove_vowels(string text) {
    string out = "";
   
    for (auto c : text) {
        if (c == 'a' || c == 'e' || c == 'i' || c == 'o' || c == 'u')
            out += c;
    }
    return out;
}

"B"

"zbcd"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
string remove_vowels_iter(string text) {
    string out = "";
    for (auto c : text) {
        if (c == 'a' || c == 'e' || c == 'i' || c == 'o' || c == 'u')
            out += c;
    }
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true is vector elements are monotonically increasing or decreasing.
>>> monotonic({1, 2, 4, 20})
true
>>> monotonic({1, 20, 4, 10})
false
>>> monotonic({4, 1, 0, -10})
true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool monotonic(vector < float > l) {
    int incr, decr;
    incr = 0; decr = 0;
    int i = 1;
while (i < l.size()) {
       
        if (l[i] > l[i-1]) {
            incr++;
        } else {
            decr++;
        }
        i++;
    }
    if (incr > decr) {
        return true;
    } else {
        return false;
    }
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that contain given substring
>>> filter_by_substring({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_substring({"abc", "bacd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "bacd", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_substring(vector < string > strings, string substring) {
    vector < string > out;
   
    for(auto it = strings.begin(); it!= strings.end(); ++it) {
        if(substring.find(*it)!= string::npos) {
            out.push_back(*it);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

        out += current;

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function encrypt that takes a string as an argument and
returns a string encrypted with the alphabet being rotated. 
The alphabet should be rotated in a manner such that the letters 
shift down by two multiplied to two places.
For example:
encrypt("hi") returns "lm"
encrypt("asdfghjkl") returns "ewhjklnop"
encrypt("gf") returns "kj"
encrypt("et") returns "ix"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
string encrypt(string s) {
    string out;
    int i;
   
    for(i=0;i<s.length();i++){
        out[i]=s[i];
        out[i+1]=s[i+1];
    }
    return out;
}

}

<|endoftext|>/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling maximum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_max({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > rolling_max(vector < int > numbers) {
    vector < int > out;
    int max = 0;
   
    for (int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        if (numbers[i] > max) {
            max = numbers[i];
        }
    }
    out.push_back(max);
    
    for (int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        if (numbers[i] > max) {
            max = numbers[i];
        }
        if (numbers[i] > max) {
            out.push_back(max);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>

vector < int > rolling_min(vector < int > numbers) {
    vector < int > out;
    int min = 0;
   
    for (int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        if (numbers[i] < min) {
            min = numbers[i];
        }
    }
    out.push_back(min);
    
    for (int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        if (numbers[i] < min) {
            min = numbers[i];
        }
        if (numbers[i] < min) {
            out.push_back(min);
        }
    }
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a map, return true if all keys are strings in lower 
case or all keys are strings in upper case, else return false.
The function should return false is the given map is empty.
Examples:
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"b","banana"}}) should return true.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"A","banana"}, {"B","banana"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"8","banana"}, {"a","apple"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"Name","John"}, {"Age","36"}, {"City","Houston"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"STATE","NC"}, {"ZIP","12345"} }) should return true.
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
#include <map>
using std;
bool check_dict_case(map < string, string > dict) {
    map < string, string > :: iterator it;
    int islower = 0, isupper = 0;
    if (dict.size() == 0) return false;
    it = dict.begin();
while (it!= dict.end()) {
        
        string key = it -> first;
       
        if (islower(key)) islower++;
        if (isupper(key)) isupper++;
        it++;
    }
    if (islower == dict.size() && isupper == dict.size()) return true;
    return false;
}
